skill.name: plotly
skill.description: Interactive scientific and statistical data visualization library for Python. Use when creating charts, plots, or visualizations including scatter plots, line charts, bar charts, heatmaps, 3D plots, geographic maps, statistical distributions, financial charts, and dashboards. Supports both quick visualizations (Plotly Express) and fine-grained customization (graph objects). Outputs interactive HTML or static images (PNG, PDF, SVG).

content.user_title: Create Plotly charts for scientific data
content.value_statement: You need clear, interactive charts for scientific and statistical data. This skill guides Plotly Express and graph objects to build, style, and export visualizations.
actual_capabilities: Guide chart selection across 40 plus Plotly chart types
Explain when to use Plotly Express versus graph objects
Show layout, styling, and subplot configuration options
Detail interactivity features like hover, zoom, and selection
Describe export to HTML and static image formats
limitations: Does not execute code or render charts
Requires Plotly installation and optional Kaleido for images
Does not perform data cleaning or statistical analysis
Mapbox styles may require a separate token

use_cases.title: Exploratory plots

prompt_templates.title: First scatter plot
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Plotly Express scatter plot from a pandas DataFrame with x, y, and a title.

prompt_templates.prompt: Build a time series line chart with rangeslider and custom axis titles and colors.

prompt_templates.title: Custom multi-trace
prompt_templates.prompt: Use graph objects to build a figure with two traces, a custom legend, and an annotation.

prompt_templates.title: Export workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to export an interactive HTML file and a PNG using Kaleido settings.

output_examples.input: Create a scatter plot with a trendline and export to PNG.
output: Use Plotly Express scatter with trendline set to ols.
Install Kaleido, then call write_image with a PNG filename.
Keep labels and title readable for reports.

best_practices: Start with Plotly Express, then refine with graph objects
Use templates to keep styling consistent across figures
Export HTML for interactivity and PNG or SVG for static sharing
anti_patterns: Using graph objects for simple one line charts
Exporting images without installing Kaleido or Chromium
Ignoring axis labels and hover details in scientific plots

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill targets Plotly for Python; use a supported Plotly version for your environment.

faq.question: Are there limits on chart types?
faq.answer: The guidance covers 40 plus chart types available in Plotly Express and graph objects.

faq.question: Can I integrate with Dash?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes guidance for using Plotly figures inside Dash layouts.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance only and does not access local files or external services.

faq.question: Why does image export fail?
faq.answer: Install Kaleido and ensure Chromium is available for static image export.

faq.question: How does it compare to Matplotlib?
faq.answer: Plotly focuses on interactive charts and web outputs, while Matplotlib is primarily static.
